slack.label: Slack
slack.description: To enable Slack notifications, create a Slack app and enable incoming webhooks. After that, simply provide the webhook URL here.

discord.label: Discord
discord.description: To send data to a Discord channel from Checkmate via Discord notifications using webhooks, you can use Discord's incoming Webhooks feature.

telegram.label: Telegram
telegram.description: To enable Telegram notifications, create a Telegram bot using BotFather, an official bot for creating and managing Telegram bots. Then, get the API token and chat ID and write them down here.
telegram.fieldsRequired: Telegram token and chat ID are required

webhook.label: Webhooks
webhook.description: You can set up a custom webhook to receive notifications when incidents occur.

infrastructureServerRequirement: The server you are monitoring must be running the
infrastructureAlertNotificationDescripti: Send a notification to user(s) when thresholds exceed a specified percentage.
integrationsPrism: Connect Prism to your favorite service.
integrationsSlackInfo: Connect with Slack and see incidents in a channel
integrationsDiscordInfo: Connect with Discord and view incidents directly in a channel
integrationsZapierInfo: Send all incidents to Zapier, and then see them everywhere
websiteMonitoringDescription: Use HTTP(s) to monitor your website or API endpoint.
pingMonitoringDescription: Check whether your server is available or not.
dockerContainerMonitoringDescription: Check whether your Docker container is running or not.
portMonitoringDescription: Check whether your port is open or not.
maintenanceWindowDescription: During maintenance windows, all monitoring is suspended for selected monitors. No network checks will be performed, preventing any status updates or notifications from being triggered. Your monitors will appear frozen at their last known status, and status pages will display a maintenance indicator. Once the maintenance window ends, monitoring automatically resumes, and alerts will trigger if issues are detected. Maintenance periods do not count against uptime calculations.
timeZoneInfo: All dates and times are in GMT+0 time zone.
monitorsToApply: Monitors to apply maintenance window to
pageSpeedConfigureSettingsDescription: Here you can select the URL of the host, together with the type of monitor.
whenNewIncident: When there is a new incident,
notifyEmails: Also notify via email to multiple addresses (coming soon)
seperateEmails: You can separate multiple emails with a comma
deleteDialogTitle: Do you really want to delete this monitor?
deleteDialogDescription: Once deleted, this monitor cannot be retrieved.
pageSpeedDetailsPerformanceReport: Values are estimated and may vary.

statusPageCreateSelectTimeZoneDescriptio: Select the timezone that your status page will be displayed in.

statusPageCreateSettingsCheckboxLabel: Published and visible to the public
statusPageCreateTabsContentDescription: You can add any number of servers that you monitor to your status page. You can also reorder them for the best viewing experience.
statusPageCreateTabsContentFeaturesDescr: Show more details on the status page
statusPageStatus: A public status page is not set up.
statusPageStatusNotPublic: This status page is not public.

EmailDescriptionText: This is your current email address — it cannot be changed.

DeleteDescriptionText: This will remove the account and all associated data from the server. This isn't reversible.
DeleteAccountWarning: Removing your account means you won't be able to sign in again and all your data will be removed. This isn't reversible.

greeting.append: The afternoon is your playground—let's make it epic!

teamPanel.inviteDescription: When you add a new team member, they will get access to all monitors.
teamPanel.noMembers: There are no team members with this role

addTeamMember.title: Register new team member
addTeamMember.description: Create a new user and share the credentials with them. This method gives the member immediate access to all monitors.

registerToast.success: User created, share credentials with the member securely.

errors.pattern: Name must contain only letters, spaces, apostrophes, or hyphens
Surname must contain only letters, spaces, apostrophes, or hyphens

errors.empty: To continue, please enter an email address
errors.invalid: Please recheck validity of entered email address

changeTeamPassword.title: Reset team member password
changeTeamPassword.description: Create a new password for this team member. You will need to share the password with them securely.
changeTeamPassword.success: Password successfully reset. Make sure to provide the credentials to the member in a secure way.

settingsEmailUser: Email user - Username for authentication, overrides email address if specified

passwordPanel.passwordRequirements: New password must contain at least 8 characters and must have at least one uppercase letter, one lowercase letter, one number and one special character.

uptimeGeneralInstructions.http: Enter the URL or IP to monitor (e.g., https://example.com/ or 192.168.1.100) and add a clear display name that appears on the dashboard.
uptimeGeneralInstructions.https: Enter the URL or IP to monitor (e.g., https://example.com/ or 192.168.1.100) and add a clear display name that appears on the dashboard.
uptimeGeneralInstructions.ping: Enter the IP address or hostname to ping (e.g., 192.168.1.100 or example.com) and add a clear display name that appears on the dashboard.
uptimeGeneralInstructions.docker: Enter the Docker container name or ID. You can use either the container name (e.g., my-app) or the container ID (full 64-char ID or short ID).
uptimeGeneralInstructions.port: Enter the URL or IP of the server, the port number and a clear display name that appears on the dashboard.
uptimeGeneralInstructions.game: Enter the IP address or hostname and the port number to ping (e.g., 192.168.1.100 or example.com) and choose game type.

errors.empty: To continue, please enter your email address

errors.length: Password must be at least 8 characters long
errors.uppercase: Password must contain at least 1 uppercase letter
errors.lowercase: Password must contain at least 1 lowercase letter

errors.special: Password must contain at least 1 special character

errors.length: Name must be less than 50 characters

emailSettings.description: Configure the email settings for your system. This is used to send notifications and alerts.
emailSettings.descriptionTransport: This builds an SMTP transport for NodeMailer
emailSettings.labelConnectionHost: Email connection host - Hostname to use in the HELO/EHLO greeting
emailSettings.labelHost: Email host - Hostname or IP address to connect to
emailSettings.labelIgnoreTLS: Disable STARTTLS: Don't use TLS even if the server supports it
emailSettings.labelPasswordSet: Password is set. Click Reset to change it.
emailSettings.labelPool: Enable connection pooling: Reuse existing connections to improve performance
emailSettings.labelPort: Email port - Port to connect to
emailSettings.labelRejectUnauthorized: Reject invalid certificates: Reject connections with self-signed or untrusted certificates
emailSettings.labelRequireTLS: Force STARTTLS: Require TLS upgrade, fail if not supported
emailSettings.labelSecure: Use SSL (recommended): Encrypt the connection using SSL/TLS
emailSettings.labelTLSServername: TLS Servername - Optional Hostname for TLS Validation when host is an IP
emailSettings.labelUser: Email user - Username for authentication, overrides email address if specified
emailSettings.title: Email
emailSettings.toastEmailRequiredFieldsError: Email address, host, port and password are required

pageSpeedSettings.description: Enter your Google PageSpeed API key to enable Google PageSpeed monitoring. Click Reset to update the key.

globalThresholds.title: Global Thresholds
globalThresholds.description: Configure global CPU, Memory, Disk, and Temperature thresholds. If a value is provided, it will automatically be enabled for monitoring.

createMonitorPage.incidentConfigDescription: A sliding window is used to determine when a monitor goes down.  The status of a monitor will only change when the percentage of checks in the sliding window meet the specified value.
createMonitorPage.incidentConfigDescriptionV2: Number of consecutive checks needed to change monitor status.  Maximum 25
createMonitorPage.incidentConfigStatusWindowLabel: How many checks should be in the sliding window?
createMonitorPage.incidentConfigStatusCheckNumber: How many checks before status change?
createMonitorPage.incidentConfigStatusWindowThresholdLabel: What percentage of checks in the sliding window fail/succeed before monitor status changes?
createMonitorPage.intervalDescription: How often the monitor should be checked.

gameServerMonitoringDescription: Check whether your game server is running or not
